meanings.definition: To raise (a bet) after an opponent has raised.
meanings.sent1: During the poker game, I decided to reraise the bet to show confidence.
meanings.sent2: In poker, it is common to reraise if you have a strong hand.
meanings.sent3: The player thought I was bluffing, so I chose to reraise and surprise them.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to reraise the bet was like a bold challenge to the other players.
meanings.sent5: With a smirk, he announced his reraise, making everyone at the table pay attention.

meanings.definition: To raise (a bet) again in a poker game.
meanings.sent1: After considering my cards, I decided to reraise and push the stakes higher.
meanings.sent2: Players often reraise when they believe they have a winning hand.
meanings.sent3: The room erupted in laughter when he jokingly tried to reraise with a tiny bet.
meanings.sent4: Her unexpected reraise was like a sudden twist in the game.
meanings.sent5: The tension rose as he prepared to reraise, making the other players nervous.
